snippet: A researcher says that 796 children may have been buried in a mass grave beside a former orphanage for the children of unmarried women.
abstract: Researcher Catherine Corless says that 796 children may have been buried in mass grave beside a former church-run orphanage for the children of unmarried women in Tuam, Ireland; records show that the children, mostly babies and toddlers, died--often of disease--in the orphanage.
lead_paragraph: A researcher says that 796 children may have been buried in a mass grave beside a former orphanage for the children of unmarried women.
